title: What is the value of a and b if a^3+b^3=91 and a^2+b^2=25? - Quora

response.answer_text: We can solve this intuitively.  Above equation asks, sum of two square number to be perfect square,  Trying number below  we may easily find  and  (Pythagorean triplet!). Now to check if it satifies other equation too,   and yes it fits perfectly. So,   Wolfram alpha gives following solution.  And Geogebra gives in following way.

a^3 + b^3 = (a+b)*(a^2 - ab+ b^2) 91 = (a+b)(25 - ab) We know 91 = 7 * 13. Hence we conclude that (a+ b )= 7 and 25 - 13 = 12 = ab While solving quadratic equations , we will find a and b , if a+ b = 7 and ab = 12 as a = 4 and b =3 or vice versa.
